knowledgeTasks.name: Hr_assistant
knowledgeTasks.description: This is used to make ontology

faqs.question: For how long I can take Paid Parental Leave?

alternateQuestions.question: For what amount of time I can require for Paid Parental Leave?
For measure of time my expectation for Paid Parental Leave?

faqs.label: For how long I can take Paid Parental Leave?

answer.text: Paid Parental Leave is designed to provide staff time and financial support to adjust to the addition of a new family member during the important period immediately following the birth or adoption of a child. Staff members are eligible to receive Paid Parental Leave during the first 12 weeks following the birth or adoption of a child. (In order to receive the full paid benefit, a staff member would need to begin his or her leave by the sixth week following a birth or adoption so he or she could take the required three consecutive weeks prior to receiving the three weeks of paid leave).

faqs.question: Who do I contact for general on-line W4 questions?

alternateQuestions.question: Who do I refer for general on-line W4 questions?
Who do I consult for general on-line W4 questions?

faqs.label: Who do I contact for general on-line W4 questions?

answer.text: You can contact the Payroll Help desk at 1-7575 for W4 questions.

alternateQuestions.question: What is the role of primary caregiver ?

answer.text: We consider someone the primary caregiver if he or she has primary responsibility for the care of a child immediately following the birth or the coming of the child into the custody, care and control of the parent for the first time. This definition applies to both births and adoptions.
The staff member determines who in his or her family is the primary caregiver by signing an affidavit as part of the Paid Parental Leave Request form.

answer.text: You can contact the Payroll Help desk at 1-7575 for W4 questions.

answer.text: To print W2 form from the HR portal.
